text: Step 1 — Validate customer and location. SQL: SELECT name, phone_number, city, pincode, account_status FROM customers WHERE customer_id = :customer_id;
Step 2 — Check area outage. SQL: SELECT issue_description, expected_resolution FROM outage_areas WHERE city = :city AND pincode = :pincode;

Step 3 — Inform customer and log chat response. SQL: INSERT INTO chat_history (customer_id, message, bot_response, intent, sentiment, timestamp) VALUES (:customer_id, :message, :bot_response, 'outage_info', 'frustrated', CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);

Step 4 — Create a broadband fault ticket. SQL: INSERT INTO tickets (customer_id, issue_type_id, description, status, priority, created_at) VALUES (:customer_id, (SELECT issue_type_id FROM issue_types WHERE name='Broadband Fault'), 'Reported outage, no area issue found', 'Open', 'High', CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);

Step 5 — Assign to the best available field agent. SQL: UPDATE tickets SET assigned_agent_id = (SELECT agent_id FROM agents WHERE department='Field Support' ORDER BY rating DESC LIMIT 1) WHERE ticket_id = :ticket_id;
Step 1 — Validate plan details. SQL: SELECT plan_name, price FROM plans WHERE plan_id = :plan_id;
Step 2 — Check transaction status. SQL: SELECT txn_id, transaction_status FROM transactions WHERE customer_id = :customer_id AND txn_date >= DATE('now','-1 day');
Step 3 — Initiate refund if failed. SQL: UPDATE transactions SET transaction_status = 'Refund Initiated' WHERE txn_id = :txn_id;

Step 4 — Confirm subscription activation. SQL: INSERT INTO subscriptions (customer_id, plan_id, start_date, end_date, status) VALUES (:customer_id, :plan_id, DATE('now'), DATE('now','+28 day'), 'Active');
Step 1 — Fetch invoice details. SQL: SELECT amount, billing_period FROM invoices WHERE customer_id = :customer_id ORDER BY due_date DESC LIMIT 1;
Step 2 — Compare with usage. SQL: SELECT mobile_data_used_gb, mobile_voice_minutes, mobile_sms_count FROM customer_usage WHERE customer_id = :customer_id AND cycle_start >= DATE('now','-30 day');
Step 3 — Validate transactions. SQL: SELECT plan_id, amount, txn_date FROM transactions WHERE customer_id = :customer_id AND txn_date >= DATE('now','-30 day');

Step 4 — Create ticket if discrepancy found. SQL: INSERT INTO tickets (customer_id, issue_type_id, description, status, priority, created_at) VALUES (:customer_id, (SELECT issue_type_id FROM issue_types WHERE name='Billing Dispute'), 'Discrepancy in bill', 'Open', 'Medium', CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);
Step 1 — Lock account immediately. SQL: UPDATE customers SET account_status = 'Locked' WHERE customer_id = :customer_id;

Step 2 — Create high-priority fraud ticket. SQL: INSERT INTO tickets (customer_id, issue_type_id, description, status, priority, created_at) VALUES (:customer_id, (SELECT issue_type_id FROM issue_types WHERE name='Fraud Alert'), 'SIM swap attempt detected', 'Open', 'Critical', CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);
Step 3 — Assign to security team. SQL: UPDATE tickets SET assigned_agent_id = (SELECT agent_id FROM agents WHERE department='Security' ORDER BY rating DESC LIMIT 1) WHERE ticket_id = :ticket_id;
Step 1 — Fetch current subscription. SQL: SELECT plan_id FROM subscriptions WHERE customer_id = :customer_id AND status='Active';
Step 2 — Show upgrade options. SQL: SELECT plan_id, plan_name, price FROM plans WHERE price > (SELECT price FROM plans WHERE plan_id=:current_plan_id);

Step 3 — Process payment. SQL: INSERT INTO transactions (customer_id, plan_id, amount, txn_date, mode, transaction_status) VALUES (:customer_id, :new_plan_id, :amount, CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, :mode, 'Success');
Step 4 — Update subscription. SQL: UPDATE subscriptions SET plan_id=:new_plan_id, start_date=CURRENT_DATE WHERE customer_id=:customer_id;
